content:
• Monday, December 24, 2018
  • PLNT

    OPK, ZNGA and APHA among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: PLNT+8.9. OPK +2.8%. ZNGA +2.2%.
    • Top Losers: MRIN -3.7%. TSEM -2.8%. SBGL -2.4%. I -2%. APHA -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • PCG

    PG&E +2% after Citi says structural changes may reduce risk

    • PG&E (PCG +1.8%) is today's only gainer in S&P 500 Utilities index after Citigroup says organizational and structural changes being considered by California regulators will "only help reduce ongoing risk without destroying shareholder value."
    • Citi analyst Praful Mehta sees California's Public Utilities Commission creating utility operating companies under a parent together with changes to governance and incentive structure as a "potential path" for reform.
    • Also, Guggenheim analysts note that CPUC sought to clarify that its probe into the utility is not looking for "punitive solutions," noting CPUC President Michael Picker's comment that the regulator's work would be a "careful and practical" process.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 3 Comments

  • Tech joins market slump

    • The tech sector (NYSEARCA:XLK) nears today's close down 1.9% as the market takes a hit from President Trump's continued Fed attacks and Treasury Secretary Mnuchin's called six U.S. banks to reassure investors, a move that mostly baffled analysts.
    • Top stories from the sector on this short trading day: Amazon receiving SEC pressure about revenue disclosure, Mindbody acquired for $1.9B, and Dell on the move days ahead of its return to public trading.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is down is down 3.4% with US-China trade tensions still hanging in the air. The S&P 500 IT index is down 1.9% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 is down 4.8%.
    • Related broad U.S. tech ETFs: XLK, VGT, TECL, FTEC, IYW, ROM, QTEC, RYT, FNG, TECS, IGM, FXL, XNTK, REW, JHMT, XITK
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 11 Comments
  • MB

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MINDBODY (NASDAQ:MB) +66%. Renren (NYSE:RENN) +18%. Gridsum Holding (NASDAQ:GSUM) +12%. Creative Realities (NASDAQ:CREX) +11%. Fang Holdings (NYSE:SFUN) +10%.
    • Losers: Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) -17%. Neonode (NASDAQ:NEON) -15%. Inpixon (NASDAQ:INPX) -11%. Foresight Autonomous Holdings (NASDAQ:FRSX) -10%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment

  • Gold hits 6-month high as equity selloff continues

    • Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin's weekend performance may or may not end up being remembered as his Kevin Bacon/Animal House moment.
    • Equity markets, however, have continued to tumble in today's shortened session (S&P 500 now down just shy of 2%), and that's giving gold a bid.
    • The yellow metal is currently higher by 1.1% to $1,272 per ounce - the strongest level since June.
    • ETFs: UGLD, UGL, DGP, GLL, GLDI, DZZ, DGL, DGLD, DGZ, GYEN, GEUR, GLDW, GHS, UBG, GHE, IAUF
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 26 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy sinks another 6% as nat gas drop drags on

    • Chesapeake Energy (CHK -6.6%) plunges to a new 52-week low as Nymex natural gas sinks -7.3% to $3.535/MMBtu and gives back nearly all of last month's big gain.
    • Other gas-focused names also are sharply lower: AM -5.2%, EQT -4.1%, RRC -3.5%, GPOR -3.4%, SWN -2.6%, AR -2.2%, COG -1.6%.
    • CHK continues its painful descent despite disclosures that Chairman Emeritus Archie Dunham and current Chairman Brad Martin paid $5.4B-plus during the last two weeks to buy shares on the open market.
    • Dunham bought 1.2M CHK shares on Dec. 18 for $2.66M, averaging $2.22/share, and bought another 1.2M shares the next day for $2.42M, or $2.02/share, bringing his total holdings to 7.25M shares, while Martin paid $350K for 135K CHK shares during Dec. 11-14 at an average $2.59/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 63 Comments

  • Utilities crumble in pre-holiday session

    • Most interesting/disturbing about today's selloff (S&P 500 down 1.7%) is that the defensive sectors are getting hit the hardest. In addition to the 3%+ decline in the REITs (see here), the utility names (NYSEARCA:XLU) are off a whopping 4.3%.
    • And this as long-term interest rates continue to slip, the 10-year Treasury yield down all the way to 2.76%.
    • ETFs: XLU, UTG, VPU, GUT, IDU, BUI, FUTY, RYU, UPW, PSCU, FXU, SDP, PUI, FUGAX, JHMU, BUYN, XU
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 73 Comments
  • DRD

    Amyris and DRDGOLD among Energy/Materials gainers; Camber Energy and Legacy Reserves among losers

    • Gainers: DRDGOLD (NYSE:DRD) +12%. Blueknight Energy Partners (NASDAQ:BKEPP) +10%. Amyris (NASDAQ:AMRS) +6%. Insteel Industries (NASDAQ:IIIN) +6%. Dawson Geophysical (NASDAQ:DWSN) +5%.
    • Losers: Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -14%. Genie Energy (NYSE:GNE) -11%. Synthesis Energy Systems (NASDAQ:SES) -11%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) -10%. CSI Compressco (NASDAQ:CCLP) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • MB

    Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MINDBODY (NASDAQ:MB) +67%. Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +31%. Renren (NYSE:RENN) +17%. Destination Maternity (NASDAQ:DEST) +16%. Savara (NASDAQ:SVRA) +16%. Dova Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DOVA) +15%. Aphria (NYSE:APHA) +14%. Provention Bio (NASDAQ:PRVB) +12%. Aeglea BioTherapeutics (NASDAQ:AGLE) +12%. Synlogic (NASDAQ:SYBX) +12%.
    • Losers: American Electric Technologies (NASDAQ:AETI) -24%. Astrotech Corporation (NASDAQ:ASTC) -23%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) -22%. Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -21%. JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) -19%. CTI BioPharma (NASDAQ:CTIC) -18%. Ability (NASDAQ:ABIL) -17%. Constellation Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CNST) -15%. ASLAN Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ASLN) -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • O

    REITs banged up badly in today's selloff

    • Today's worst-performing names are the REITs, with the iShares U.S. Real Estate ETF (NYSEARCA:IYR) down just shy of 3% vs. the S&P 500's 1.5% drop.
    • Retail-landlords are being particularly hard-hit: Realty Income (O -5.2%), National Retail (NNN -4.9%), CBL (CBL -6.5%), Washington Prime (WPG -3.8%), EPR Properties (EPR -4.5%), PREIT (PEI -3.5%), Wheeler REIT (WHLR -5.3%).
    • Losses aren't limited to retail, though: Omega Health (OHI -3.6%), Welltower (WELL -4.6%), Stag Industrial (STAG -3.9%), Prologis (PLD -3.8%), City Office (CIO -5%), W.P. Carey (WPC -4.6%), Public Storage (PSA -2.3%).
    • Mortgage REITs as well: Annaly (NLY -1.5%), Two Harbors (TWO -2.9%), New York Mortgage (NYMT -2.6%), Invesco Mortgage (IVR -2.4%).
    • ETFs: VNQ, MORL, IYR, REM, RQI, MORT, SCHH, RNP, RFI, KBWY, DRN, NRO, URE, ICF, XLRE, JRS, RWR, SRS
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 198 Comments
  • YRIV

    Forestar Group and Jupai Holdings among financial gainers; Marine Petroleum Trust leads losers

    • Gainers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) +8%. Forestar Group (NYSE:FOR) +6%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +5%. MoneyGram International (NYSE:MGI) +5%. Maiden Holdings (NASDAQ:MHLD) +5%.
    • Losers: Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) -21%. LM Funding America (NASDAQ:LMFA) -14%. Impac Mortgage Holdings (NYSEMKT:IMH) -11%. Leju Holdings (NYSE:LEJU) -10%. Medallion Financial (NASDAQ:MFIN) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • PCG

    PG&E says open to alternatives as California regulators consider breakup

    • Pacific Gas & Electric (PCG +2.2%) says it is open to "a range of solutions" that will make its energy system safer after California's Public Utilities Commission said last Friday that it will consider drastic changes at the utility including a potential breakup.
    • The CPUC said on Friday that it also will consider whether PG&E’s board and executive management should be replaced, but that it had not reached any conclusions on how it will act and will seek public input through Jan. 30.
    • PUC President Michael Picker said the regulator "must be careful and practical" in its process, which "will be like repairing a jetliner while it’s in flight. Crashing a plane to make it safer isn’t good for the passengers."
    • Regulators have been examining PG&E’s safety policies ever since a 2010 gas pipeline explosion killed eight people and destroyed 38 homes in a San Francisco suburb; the utility is now under investigation over whether its equipment started last month's wildfires that killed at least 86 people and destroyed nearly 15K homes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 11 Comments
  • DELL

    Dell -26% heading towards public listing

    • Dell's (DVMT) tracking stock is in motion after Friday's shareholder decision on the form of consideration they will receive in the buyback deal.
    • WallachBeth event-driven strategist Brett Buckley estimates that each DVMT share received 1.806 Dell shares. (Source: Bloomberg First Word)
    • Dell Class C shares are expected to start trading on the NYSE on December 28 after the deal closes.
    • Dell shares are down 26% to $75.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 24 Comments
  • PME

    Eastman Kodak and Westport Fuel among consumer gainers; JAKKS Pacific leads the losers

    • Gainers: Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) +10%. Calyxt (NASDAQ:CLXT) +7%. Eastman Kodak (NYSE:KODK) +6%. The Lovesac (NASDAQ:LOVE) +5%. Westport Fuel Systems (NASDAQ:WPRT) +5%.
    • Losers: JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) -18%. Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) -13%. Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) -9%. Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) -8%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • MAT

    Mattel sinks on DC Comics licensing loss

    • Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) is extending its longest streak of daily declines since 2015 after Goldman Sachs cut estimates following the toymaker's loss of licensing for certain DC Comics products, including boys' action toys.
    • Mattel is expected to "aggressively pursue" new licenses, especially since Hasbro's licenses to Marvel and Star Wars expires in 2020.
    • Mattel shares, which are already trading at an 18-year low, dropped another 4.5% this morning. The stock is down 40% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments

  • David Tepper is doing some buying

    • Hedge funder David Tepper made plenty of news last week, saying the Fed "put" was dead, and that "cash" might be the place to be.
    • CNBC this morning reports Tepper as saying he's "nibbling" on some stocks.
    • It's thin action, and the Tepper news might be credited with a 1% reversal in the S&P 500 - now down just 0.5% vs. 1.5% minutes ago. The Nasdaq has gone green.
    • ETFs: SPY, VOO, SH, SDS, IVV, SSO, SPXU-OLD, UPRO, SPXL, RSP, CRF, SPXS, VFINX, USA, SCHX, ZF, VV, EPS, FEX, JKD, BXUB, EQL, SPLX, EEH, SPUU
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 224 Comments
  • LMT

    Defense stocks tumble as Trump forces early ouster for Mattis

    • Defense names trade broadly lower following this weekend's news that Pres. Trump was forcing out Defense Secretary Mattis on Jan. 1, two months earlier than his planned departure: LMT -4.3%, NOC -2.9%, GD -2.8%, BA -2.2%, RTN -1.9%, LLL -1.8%.
    • Trump said Deputy Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan, a former Boeing executive, would take over on an acting basis from Jan. 1.
    • Shanahan joined Boeing in 1986 and held senior positions in the company’s commercial aircraft, helicopter and missile defense units over the course of three decades; he left his position as a Boeing senior VP for supply chain and operations in early 2017 to become Deputy Defense Secretary, and had no background in policy and legislative affairs before joining the Pentagon.
    • Separately, LMT says the U.S. and allied military forces will upgrade missile defense capabilities via a $1.8B contract for its Patriot PAC-3 air and missile defense system.
    • The contract includes deliveries for the U.S. Army and foreign military sales of PAC-3 and PAC-3 MSE interceptors, launcher modification kits and associated equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 59 Comments
  • ADIL

    Savara and CRISPR Therapeutics among healthcare gainers; EyePoint Pharmaceuticals and Novus Therapeutics among losers

    • Gainers: Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) +25%. Savara (NASDAQ:SVRA) +15%. Marinus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MRNS) +10%. Trinity Biotech (NASDAQ:TRIB) +10%. CRISPR Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRSP) +8%.
    • Losers: Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -18%. EyePoint Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:EYPT) -16%. Alpine Immune Sciences (NASDAQ:ALPN) -15%. Rubius Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RUBY) -14%. Novus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NVUS) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • RPM

    RPM downgraded to Underweight on valuation by J.P. Morgan

    • RPM International (RPM -3.4%) sinks to a six-month low after J.P. Morgan downgrades shares to Underweight from Neutral with a $55 price target, trimmed from $60, citing valuation after an 11% YTD increase.
    • The market is already discounting about half of RPM's three-year cost saving target, and the stock trades at a premium to peers because of its activist involvement and $290M cost reduction target to be achieved during FY 2020-22, says JPM analyst Jeffrey Zekauskas.
    • The analyst concedes RPM may be capable of achieving all or part of its targeted cost savings in a low raw material cost environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • ASTC

    Astrotech erases Friday's big gains

    • It's another down day for the market, but Astrotech (NASDAQ:ASTC) is taking it particularly hard.
    • The stock is 25% lower to $3.71/share, erasing most of Friday's gains when it soared to $5.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • HYGS

    Hydrogenics climbs after $20.5M private placement

    • Hydrogenics (NASDAQ:HYGS) soars another 11% in early trade, tacking on the same amount of gains as Friday, when it announced a $20.5M private placement and technology partnership with Air Liquide.
    • The company intends to use the proceeds for the purpose of funding current operations, technology developments and future scale-up of partners.
    • Following completion of the private placement, Air Liquide's interest in Hydrogenics is expected to be approximately 18.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 13 Comments

  • Stocks down sharply in early action

    • Futures were in the green for most of the overnight session, but turned negative a couple of hours ago. Those losses have continued into the open, with the S&P 500 off 1.4% about 20 minutes into the session.
    • The Nasdaq is lower by 1.5%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is down two basis points to 2.76%.
    • Treasury Secretary Mnuchin yesterday afternoon promised a meeting today of the President's Working Group on financial markets (otherwise known as the Plunge Protection Team).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 21 Comments
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor still seeks China merger nod; ORBK -4%

    • KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) and Orbotech (NASDAQ:ORBK) announce that the former remains in advanced talks with the State Administration for Market Regulation of the People's Republic of China to receive merger clearance as early as possible in 2019.
    • The merger entered an in-depth Phase 2 review in China in late July.
    • KLAC is down 2.4% and ORBK is down 4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla tumbles after price cuts, reimbursement promise

    • Responding to a comment on Twitter, Elon Musk over the weekend said Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) will "cover the tax credit difference" for those customers for whom production delays mean they won't receive their cars until next year.
    • The tax law allow allows for a full tax credit of $7.5K this year, but that drops to $3,750 on January 1. Tesla earlier pledged those who placed orders by Oct. 15 would receive their cars (and the full tax credit) by year-end, but production delays have at least some still waiting for delivery.
    • Also from the weekend: Tesla cuts Model 3 prices in China (Dec. 23)
    • Shares -2.2% premarket
    • Update at 12:55 ET: Tesla's slide has extended to 7.2% just ahead of the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 540 Comments
  • MB

    Thin ranks in premarket gainers

    • MINDBODY (NASDAQ:MB) +68% on being acquired by Vista Equity Partners for $1.9B.
    • Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) +9% on FDA approval of INBRIJA.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • CEI

    TLRY, CRON and CEI among premarket losers

    • Camber Energy (NYSEMKT:CEI) -24% on announcing effectiveness of 1-for-25 reverse stock split.
    • New Age Beverages (NASDAQ:NBEV) -15%.
    • Tilray (NASDAQ:TLRY) -8%.
    • Uxin (NASDAQ:UXIN) -5%.
    • Cronos Group (NASDAQ:CRON) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 4 Comments
  • AMZN

    SEC pressures Amazon on Prime revenue (update)

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) is among the companies the SEC is pressing to disclose more revenue information to investors, according to WSJ sources.
    • The SEC wants Amazon to disclose how much of its revenue comes from Amazon Prime customers. Amazon argues that information isn't meaningful.
    • In a letter to the tech giant, the SEC noted that Amazon publicly announced topping 100M paid Prime members and 5B shipped Prime items last year and should disclose the associated revenue figures.
    • A recent accounting rule change says companies should consider revealing more revenue information if particular sources are mentioned in earnings releases or calls without any associated revenue data.
    • The SEC isn't forcing the issue right now but plans to continue putting pressure on companies in the new year. If companies continue to refuse, the SEC could insist on the revenue information.
    • Amazon shares are down 1.9% premarket to $1,352.
    • Update: Ford (NYSE:F) and Paccar (NASDAQ:PCAR) shares are also down on revenue disclosure pressure from the SEC.
    • The SEC asked Ford last summer about why it reports vehicle revenue together with parts and accessories revenue. Ford said the two were similar enough for disclosure purposes.
    • Paccar was asked in June if it has considered breaking out fleet customer data since it was mentioned in an earnings call and filings. Paccar said it doesn't manage the business on that basis.
    • As of about 10:50 AM ET, Amazon is up 0.8%, Ford is down 3.2%, and Paccar down 0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 63 Comments
  • AAPL

    Chinese companies boycott Apple

    • Chinese companies urge employees to boycott (NASDAQ:AAPL) following the U.S. arrest of Huawei's CFO, according to Nikkei Asian Review.
    • Some companies are offering employee subsidies to buy Huawei phones, which could create further sales troubles for the new iPhone models.
    • Apple shares are down 1% premarket to $149.30.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 130 Comments
  • ETH-USD

    Ether co-founded calls bottom; cryptos continue bounce

    • "I am calling the cryptobottom of 2018," tweeted Ethereum (ETH-USD) co-founder Joseph Lubin on Friday afternoon.
    • "This bottom is marked by an epic amount of fear, uncertainty, and doubt from our friends in the 4th and crypto-5th estates."
    • Ether this morning is up another 13.5% to $149. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) is up 5% to $4.2K; Ripple (XRP-USD) +17.5% to $0.44; Bitcoin Cash (BCH-USD) +4% to $204; Litecoin (LTC-USD) +6.4% to $35.75.
    • OTCQX:GBTC no action premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 23 Comments
  • ADIL

    Adial Pharmaceuticals retires all outstanding debt

    • Adial Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ADIL) announces that the holder of the sole remaining, outstanding convertible note has fully converted the balance of the note into common shares of the Company.
    • As previously reported, the convertible note had a face value of $325,000 and was convertible into 162,500 shares of common stock.
    • Shares are down 9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • MB

    Vista will acquire Mindbody for $1.9B

    • Mindbody (NASDAQ:MB) agrees to be acquired by Vista Equity Partners for $1.9B.
    • The total represents $36.50 per share in cash, a 68% premium to Friday's close.
    • The transaction is expected to close in Q1.
    • Mindbody shares were halted ahead of the news and will resume trading at 8:30 AM.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 1 Comment

  • Oil dives to new lows

    • Modestly higher earlier this morning maybe thanks to an OPEC pledge to prop up prices, oil has reversed, with the decline picking up steam over the past half hour (alongside a reversal to the downside in stock index futures). Has someone told OPEC it's no longer the world's marginal producer?
    • WTI crude is now off 1.5% and below $45 per barrel for the first time since the summer of 2017.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, UGA, DTO, USL, DNO, OLO, UHN, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 40 Comments

  • Perrigo raised to Outperform at IBI

    • Following a 30% plunge on Friday after the disclosure of a €1.64B ($1.9B) bill for back taxes in Ireland, Perrigo is seeing some positive sentiment.
    • Shares are now up 2.4% premarket as IBI upgraded the stock to Outperform with a price target of $47.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM
